title: Commemorating the 35th Anniversary of the Center for Spectrum Services during Autism Awareness Month, April 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION commemorating the 35th Anniversary of the Center
for Spectrum Services during Autism Awareness Month, April 2011

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that  the
quality  and  character of life in the communities across New York State
are reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those organiza-
tions and individuals that are devoted to the welfare of  the  community
and its citizenry; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commem-
orate  the  35th  Anniversary  of the Center for Spectrum Services; this
auspicious occasion will be celebrated during the month of  April  2011,
which is Autism Awareness Month; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1976  when  parents  of  children with autism were often
adrift and alone in facing their child's diagnosis,  Susan  Buckler  and
Jamey Wolff founded a school with just two students in a church basement
with  a  vision  to  provide the treatment and education this population
deserved; it was launched under the name of The Children's Annex; and
  WHEREAS, By 1983, The Children's Annex had doubled  its  student  body
annually,  was  operating  in  two  locations, had initiated a preschool
program, collaborated with parents and staff to found the Hudson  Valley
Autism Society, and widened its geographic range; and
  WHEREAS,  In the autumn of 2009, The Children's Annex changed the name
of the school to the Center for Spectrum Services; this was confirmed by
the New York State Board of Regents in July 2009; and
  WHEREAS, The vision of the Center for Spectrum Services is  to  be  an
exemplary   educational,   treatment   and  diagnostic  center  offering
evidence-based programs which lead to optimal outcomes  for  individuals
and families impacted by autism spectrum disorders; and
  WHEREAS,  The mission of the Center for Spectrum Services is to evalu-
ate the needs of children with autism  spectrum  disorders  and  develop
nurturing,  therapeutic  learning  environments  that  foster  their own
growth, and that of the professionals who serve them; it  believes  that
family, staff and community collaboration is the cornerstone of success;
and
  WHEREAS,  The  Center  for  Spectrum  Services  operates  center-based
schools and programs in both Kingston and  Ellenville,  New  York,  with
reach  into  14  counties in the Hudson Valley; for the 2010-2011 school
year, it is serving students from 37 school districts  in  six  counties
throughout the Hudson Valley; and
  WHEREAS,  The Center also operates the Spectrum Services Clinic, which
serves people of all ages with known or suspected autism spectrum disor-
ders; the clinic offers a variety  of  services  including  evaluations,
consultations, trainings and individual and group counseling; and
  WHEREAS,  Serving 270 individuals with autism spectrum disorders annu-
ally, the Center for Spectrum Services has served a  cumulative  enroll-
ment  of  3,500 over the past 35 years; it has provided training to over
4,000 professionals and parents across New York and the nation; and
  WHEREAS, April 2011 is Autism Awareness Month; and
  WHEREAS, This auspicious occasion presents a  unique  opportunity  for
this  Legislative  Body  to  recognize and pay tribute to the Center for
Spectrum Services  and  to  congratulate  it  on  its  achievements  and
progress; and
  WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when an organ-
ization of such noble aims and accomplishments is brought to our  atten-
tion,  it should be recognized and applauded by all the citizens of this
great Empire State; now, therefore, be it

  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commemorate  the  35th  Anniversary of the Center for Spectrum Services;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  the  Center for Spectrum Services, 70 Kukuk Lane, Kingston,
New York 12401.
